required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Endoscopic Ultrasound-Guided Fiducial Placement for Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: EUS-Guided Fiducial Placement for Stereotactic Body Radiotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to evaluate placing the radiation therapy markers (Fiducial) by using an endoscopic procedure. The endoscopic procedure is called an Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS). This is a procedure using a special endoscope that has an ultrasound on the end. The ultrasound will allow the doctor's to see where the radiation therapy markers (Fiducial) is to be placed as outlined by the Radiation Oncologist.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the success and accuracy of endoscopic delivery of the Fiducials into pre-selected targets using dedicated EUS fiducial delivery system.
primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure for this study is to determine: The successful delivery, to the targeted tissue,of the fiducials through the fiducial delivery system, The accuracy of the fiducial delivery into the targeted tissue and to see if the fiducials can be visualized via Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS), Fluoroscopy and/or CT scan. The success and accuracy of the delivery will be evaluated by Endoscopic Ultrasound, fluoroscopy and/or CT scan to determine if the fiducials are in the targeted tissue. The subject's Oncologist will inform the endoscopist of the targeted tissue that is to receive the fiducials.

intervention.description: Endoscopic Ultrasound (EUS) used for the placement of fiducial markers in tissue as outlined by the radiation oncologist

study_pop.textblock: All subjects who are currently scheduled to undergo fiducial placement at the University of Florida in Gainesville as medically indicated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 years or older,
- Scheduled to undergo fiducial placement,
- Subject must be able to give informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any contraindication to performing endoscopy,
- Participation in another research protocol that could interfere or influence the outcomes measures of the present study,
- The subject is unable/unwilling to give informed consent
